poem:
"Pastel Shading the Bulldog"

In the room of birth,
Cloaked with vintage twilight -
The portrait emerges,
distilled from seven decades of silence.

Not Churchill liked,
yet Sutherland painted,
each brush stroke revealing
the naked soul of a warrior.

Auctioned off in June,
it stands still in the hush,
Intimate and defiant, 
as history begins to blush.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Study for portrait Winston Churchill disliked goes on show at his old home An intimate study of Winston Churchill that has been in private hands for seven decades has gone on show in the room at Blenheim Palace in which Britain’s most famous prime minister was born, before being auctioned in June. It was the work of Graham Sutherland, one of the most highly regarded artists of his time. Sutherland was commissioned to paint Churchill". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Study for portrait Winston Churchill disliked goes on show at his old home An intimate study of Winston Churchill that has been in private hands for seven decades has gone on show in the room at Blenheim Palace in which Britain’s most famous prime minister was born, before being auctioned in June. It was the work of Graham Sutherland, one of the most highly regarded artists of his time. Sutherland was commissioned to paint Churchill
